snippet: The Japanese prime minister announced that his government would reinterpret the antiwar Constitution to allow the armed forces to come to the aid of friendly nations.
abstract: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe announces a reinterpretation of country's pacifist Constitution; decision frees nation's military, for first time in over six decades, to play a more assertive role in increasingly tense region; revision will also allow Japan's military to come to the aid of friendly countries under attack, including the United States.

byline.original: By MARTIN FACKLER and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Martin Fackler reported from Tokyo, and David E. Sanger from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Japanese prime minister announced that his government would reinterpret the antiwar Constitution to allow the armed forces to come to the aid of friendly nations.

headline.main: Japan Announces a Military Shift to Thwart China
